marketNews.title: Oil Spikes After Biden Mentions Possibility of Israel Attacking Iran
marketNews.content: Crude oil prices in the futures market surged +5.03% to USD 77.62 per barrel in trading on Thursday (3/10) night after US President Joe Biden stated that the US and Israel were discussing the possibility of attacking Iranian oil facilities. The strengthening continued on Friday (4/10), with Brent crude oil prices in the futures market rising +1.12% to USD 78.5 per barrel. BBC reported that Biden made this statement while leaving the White House and it did not clearly describe the US government's stance. Biden previously stated that he would not support an Israeli attack on Iran's nuclear facilities. Biden's statement came just one day after an anonymous Israeli official told Axios that Israel would launch a retaliatory strike, likely targeting Iranian oil production facilities and other strategic locations. Previously, Iran launched its largest attack on Israel on Tuesday (1/10), intended as retaliation for Israel's offensive against Hezbollah in Lebanon last weekend. Iran itself is the third-largest oil producer in the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC), with production reaching 3.7 million barrels per day in August 2024, or about 4% of total global production. Key Takeaway: As previously written in Stockbit Snips, oil prices in the short term will depend on geopolitical developments. According to the Head of Commodity Analysis at Swedish bank SEB, Bjarne Schieldrop, oil prices have the potential to surge up to USD 200 per barrel if all of Iran's oil infrastructure is destroyed. Oil and gas supporting issuers' stocks strengthened again today, Friday (4/10), with MEDC +3.65%, ENRG +6.19%, ELSA +3.24%, LEAD +4.0%, and WINS +1.67%, driven by the sentiment of rising oil prices. This article was first released in Stockbit Commentary.

marketNews.title: Prabowo-Gibran National Campaign Team Adjusting 2025 State Budget Oil Price Assumption
marketNews.content: The Deputy Commander of the Prabowo Subianto-Gibran National Campaign Team for Young Voters, Anggawira, stated that the Prabowo Subianto administration will likely adjust the oil price assumption in the 2025 State Budget (APBN) through a Revised State Budget (APBN-P). This discussion aims to achieve a more realistic projection based on market conditions and maintain the accuracy of state expenditure calculations, especially regarding energy subsidies. The 2025 APBN assumes an Indonesian Crude Price of USD 82 per barrel.

marketNews.title: India Approves $1.2 Billion Program to Double Edible Oil Output
marketNews.content: The Indian government on Thursday (3/10) approved a program worth USD 1.2 billion to double edible oil production in the country within 7 years, aiming to reduce dependence on imports. India is the world's largest importer of edible oils, fulfilling nearly two-thirds of its consumption through imports of CPO, soybean oil, and sunflower oil from abroad, especially from Indonesia, Malaysia, Argentina, Brazil, Russia, and Ukraine.

marketNews.title: US Weekly Initial Jobless Claims Rise Moderately
marketNews.content: The number of initial jobless claims in the US recorded a rise of 6,000 from the previous week, reaching 225,000 for the week ending September 28, 2024, surpassing the consensus expectation of 220,000 and marking the highest level in the last 3 weeks.

marketNews.title: US Service Sector Activity Accelerates in September 2024
marketNews.content: The Institute for Supply Management recorded that the Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) for the US service sector jumped to 54.9 in September 2024 (vs. August 2024: 51.5), exceeding the forecast of 51.7 and marking the strongest growth since February 2023.

marketNews.title: BEI Officially Implements New Rules for Short Selling and Margin
marketNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) officially issued and enforced new trading rules regarding short selling and margin on Thursday (3/10). Nevertheless, IDX Director, Jeffrey Hendrik, stated that as of yet, no exchange members have applied for a short selling license, although 23 exchange members have expressed interest. Jeffrey estimates that some exchange members will obtain short selling licenses by the end of 2024, so that short selling transactions can at least be conducted starting in 1Q25.

tickerNews.title: AUTO to Distribute Interim Dividend of Rp57/Share, Indicating 2.4% Yield
tickerNews.content: AUTO: Astra Otoparts will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to IDR 274.7 billion or IDR 57 per share. The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiated markets is October 14, 2024, with payment on October 24, 2024. Referring to AUTO's stock price on Friday (4/10) at IDR 2,360 per share, the implied dividend yield is 2.4%.

tickerNews.title: BRIS Director Hery Gunardi Increases Shareholding via Remuneration
tickerNews.content: BRIS: The shareholding of the President Director of Bank Syariah Indonesia, Hery Gunardi, increased by 976,800 shares in BRIS at an average price of IDR 3,071 per share on September 26, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 3 billion. Following this transaction, Hery Gunardi's ownership in BRIS increased from 0.005% to 0.007%.

tickerNews.title: TAPG Joint Venture with Aisin Takaoka to Start Commercial Operations in Early 2026
tickerNews.content: TAPG: Corporate Secretary of Triputra Agro Persada, Joni Tjeng, stated that the joint venture between TAPG and Aisin Takaoka Co. Ltd. in the bio-coke sector will commence commercial operations in early 2026. The joint venture will produce palm kernel shell-based bio-coke. Bio-coke itself is an alternative fuel for the steel casting industry, which currently relies on coking coal.

tickerNews.title: SUNI to Build Second Factory in Batam Valued at IDR 432 Billion
tickerNews.content: SUNI: Director of Sunindo Pratama, Freddy Soejandy, stated that the company plans to build a second factory worth IDR 432 billion in Batam, targeted for completion in 1Q25 or 2Q25. This move is driven by the full utilization rate at the existing factory, although Freddy did not disclose the installed capacity of the new plant. SUNI produces oil country tubular goods (OCTG) pipes used in the oil and gas industry. Besides the oil and gas industry, Freddy mentioned that SUNI plans to expand into the geothermal supporting industry, but this plan is still in the market development stage.

tickerNews.title: MSTI Issues MESOP Tranche I of Approximately 16 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: MSTI: Mastersystem Infotama issued a stock option right offering to management and employees (MESOP) tranche I amounting to approximately 16 million shares at an exercise price of 1,482 per share. These option rights have an option life until November 8, 2026.

tickerNews.title: PMMP Controller Sold 48.2 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: PMMP: The controller of Panca Mitra Multiperdana, PT Tiga Makin Jaya, sold 48.2 million PMMP shares at an average price of IDR 159 per share from September 26 to October 3, 2024. The total transaction value reached IDR 7.7 billion. After this transaction, PT Tiga Makin Jaya's ownership in PMMP decreased from 39.1% to 37.2%.

tickerNews.title: AMAN Controller Johan Tedja Surya Purchased Approximately 13.2 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: AMAN: The Controller and President Commissioner of Makmur Berkah Amanda, Johan Tedja Surya, purchased approximately 13.2 million AMAN shares at an average price of IDR 114 per share on October 2, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 1.5 billion. After this transaction, Johan Tedja Surya's ownership in AMAN increased from 2.91% to 3.25%.

tickerNews.title: ADHI's Debt Payment Obligation Postponement Lawsuit Dismissed
tickerNews.content: Adhi Karya (ADHI) announced that the lawsuit for the postponement of debt payment obligations (PKPU) filed against the company by PT Dutasari Citralaras and Machfud Suroso as the President Director of PT Dutasari Citralaras was rejected by the court on Thursday (3/10). Previously, PT Dutasari Citralaras and Machfud Suroso sued ADHI for PKPU amounting to IDR 91 billion related to the Hambalang project at the end of September 2024.

tickerNews.title: CBUT Prepares to Enter Packaged Cooking Oil Market Under Own Brand
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Citra Borneo Utama (CBUT), Ronny Hertantyo Raharjo, told Investor Daily that the company is preparing to enter the packaged cooking oil market under its own brand. The downstream palm oil product (olein) packaged by CBUT will come in pillow pack and bottle forms, targeting national-scale sales. However, as an initial step, the sale of packaged cooking oil will first target the local market, such as Central Kalimantan and the regional level (all of Kalimantan).
